body:
This one of the best things i can find for under $1000, although i plan on upgrading the ram to 16gb.
Does anyone have any advice i'm not to good with this :P
thanks for anyone who takes the time to give me advice :)

replies.body: Look, even potatos buy parts from https://pccasegear.com/.

ok whatever you do, do not buy an Alienware. i have had Alienware products and they tend to only last 1-2 years max before some obscure problem happens to them. That and they are like the Mac equivalent to PC. I would suggest building it ALL by hand with parts you can get fro cheaper than a whole built rig off the net.

You could buy a half-decent readybuilt computer which most likely wont be upgradable for that $1000, or you can custom build it with upgradeable slots and for cheaper as buying the pasts separately can save you a F-tonne of money, especially in the long run.

I would Reccommend https://pccasegear.com/ as i have many a friend who have purchased parts from their site and can vouch for cheaper and more reliable gaming hardware then conventional prebuilt commercial rigs.

there's no point in upgrading your ram to 16g as pretty much every game out today is 'restricted' to 8g

you don't need an i7 and the gpu is terrible

you're much better getting something from here http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=index&cPath=1411&zenid=1086b5fc3cf31a3b5a5ed707067038ab

Mostly correct. The GPU is terrible, but upgrading to 16GB isn't a bad idea since 8GB will eventually be considered "not enough" and by that time, 8GB sticks will be obsolete and you will have to purchase 16GB again, instead of just upgrading 8GB.

But there isn't a lot of point doing it with this PC, the CPU is really good, the ram is fine, the hard drive is average, but the GPU is god awful. Like, that GPU is literally not even better than integrated graphics. There is no point at all having 16GB of ram, and then having a GPU that would hardly run LoL on high and get 60 FPS.

tl;dr avoid this PC at any cost, them putting "Alienware" on it, adds $200 to the total build cost instantly.

If there was something in it for me, I would pick out some good parts for you.

by the time games require more than 8g of ram you'll be able to buy 16g ddr4 for $20


a $300 gpu can run most games out today on high with 60 fps


edit: you should probably look into overclocking if you want the most out of your equipment too
